poem:
"Murmurations in Gaza"

Pain echoes in the rain-soaked cobbles of Shejaiya,
Nine souls sifted out by rage's thunder.
Under a sky churning with dark laughter, 
the world's indifferent hands fold,
Catching the tears of soldiers and mothers alike.
In the lattice of war pulses an irony -
That humanity becomes the common casualty,
And all we are left with, is its poetry.
prompt: You are the poet Elizabeth Bishop. You woke up this morning feeling ironic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Gaza: Israeli commanders among nine soldiers killed in Hamas ambush Two senior Israeli commanders and seven other soldiers have been killed by Hamas in a complex ambush in the Gaza City suburb of Shejaiya, an area that has seen intense urban fighting in recent days. The latest Israeli combat deaths came amid fears of a rapidly escalating humanitarian crisis in Gaza as heavy winter rains lashed the region and after reports by aid agencies of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
